label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: brocaded on satin weave

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Robert T. Hoyt in memory of Hannah McAllister

label: Description
value: Triangular shaped ivory wool shawl fragment, densely embroidered with ivory silk in compartmentalized floral patterns. Chain stitch border with long fringe. 2/2 twill ground fabric which has been brushed, patterned by a tightly plied ivory silk yarn couched with a single ivory silk yarn. The plied silk yarn is looped as it is couched to form a linear pattern with a distinctive quality.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on wool Technique: embroidered on twill weave

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1968: Mrs. Robert T. Hoyt collection; 1968: acquired by the Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Robert T. Hoyt in memory of Hannah McAllister
Ticket to the World's Columbian Exposition, Expressly for Manhattan Day, Oct. 21st 1893

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Dr. Richard P. Wunder

label: Description
value: White Kashmir shawl with narrow border embroidered in bright silks in small "cone" pattern; trimmed with narrow silk fringe. Arranged as cape with hood, by attaching edges at one point.

label: Description
value: Oblong shawl of white Kashmir wool with wide end borders and narrow side borders in brilliant colors, mainly in a paisley motif. Border in tapestry weave with embroidered outlines and details, mainly in red. Corner ornaments embroidered in brilliant colors.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool Technique: embroidered on tapestry weave
Gothic Revival design with landscape vignette

label: Description
value: On ground of polished white, predominantly architectural pattern with gothic details, in brown, beiges, brilliant blues, green, touches of red. Fanciful architectural enframement, topped by two vases of flowers, flanked by two statues on pedestals under steep "gothic" roofs, between which country scene with four peasant figures visible. Above, enframed in leafy architectural ornament, wooden bridge over tree-lined stream. At edge of paper, vertical banding of strapwork with fruit garland, through which vine with red flowers is entwined.

label: Notes
value: On ground of polished white, predominantly architectural pattern with gothic details, in brown, beiges, brilliant blues, green, touches of red. Fanciful architectural enframement, topped by two vases of flowers, flanked by two statues on pedestals under steep "gothic" roofs, between which country scene with four peasant figures visible. Above, enframed in leafy architectural ornament, wooden bridge over tree-lined stream. At edge of paper, vertical banding of strapwork with fruit garland, through which vine with red flowers is entwined.

label: Description
value: (a) Flower bud form glass shade for sconce. Over-all iridescent finish with green, yellow, orange tones predominating. Green veined, pointed leaf forms rise from base. Out-curving lip with five indentations giving lip slightly lobed outline. (b, c, d, and e) Same basic shapes, colors, free forms of leaves varying slightly. Color variation most noticeable in (c) where color is darker.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Lyall Dean; 1968: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Table with Chinese cloisonné enamel top set into an octagonal gilt-metal from which eight bells hang; the bronze base in Chinese style, highlighted with gilding with elephant head feet.

label: Provenance
value: John Taylor Johnston [1]; Mrs. D. Chester Noyes [2]; 1968: acquired by Museum                 [1] first President of MMA, 8 Fifth Avenue New York, NY [2] his granddaughter

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. D. Chester Noyes

label: Description
value: Upholstery fabric in two shades of green. Pattern is an ogival frame enclosing stiff tree form with three pointed leaves. Suggest Art Nouveau style.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: machine woven

label: Description
value: Brown, rust and white on tan grounded paper. Large brick-like rectangles in all-over arrangement like diagonal or plumb bonded bricks. Each rectangle formed of lines arranged to give effect of shading imitating a raised stone or wooden panel. Space between rectangles filled with solid, darker brown.

label: Provenance
value: Found in north stair hall, 2nd floor on east wall of Rose Hill, built 1839,Geneva, New York.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Geneva Historical Society, Geneva, NY

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Geneva Historical Society, Geneva, NY

label: Description
value: On white ground, orange cable molding or rope twist, outlined in black.

label: Provenance
value: Found pasted over moire of 1968-66-9 in ground floor room, Hurd House, Woodbury, Connecticut, built from 1680 on.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Old Woodbury Historical Society

label: Description
value: On embossed metallic gold ground, tangle of foliage in gray and white. Aesthetic style design with dense mix of vining foliage.

label: Provenance
value: Top, newest, layer of wallpaper found in ground floor room, Hurd House, built from 1680 on, in Woodbury, Connecticut.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Old Woodbury Historical Society

label: Description
value: On gray ground, large-scale, formalized pattern of floral and foliage forms in ombred shades of blue and of white.

label: Provenance
value: Found pasted on top of 1968-66-5, ground floor room, Hurd House, built 1680in Woodbury, Connecticut. This is the third oldest layer on wall. Clear impression on reverse of 1968-66-5,-6. Accompanied by border 1968-66-8.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Old Woodbury Historical Society

label: Description
value: On white ground, continuous banding of red flowers and green foliage. Ahdered to sidewall with Irise or rainbow print.

label: Provenance
value: Accompanied 1968-66-7 in third oldest layer of wallpaper found on wall of ground floor room, Hurd House, Woodbury, Connecticut, built from 1680 on.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Old Woodbury Historical Society

label: Description
value: There is no pattern remaining on this top layer of paper. The surface has the appearance of a woodgrain or moire pattern but is actually worm eaten. The layer below has an indiscernable pattern. Possibly a rainbow or irise paper, it is printed in shades of blue.

label: Provenance
value: Background of pattern rotted away. This portion was fourth oldest layer of wallpaper in ground floor room, Hurd House, built from 1680 on, Woodbury, Connecticut.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Old Woodbury Historical Society

label: Description
value: Fragment in light brown printed with a stylized leaf design in brown and red in a small allover pattern.

label: Description
value: Round fragment of cream-colored cotton block printed in reds, violet, and green.  A floral pattern is arranged to fill a circle of flower heads. Center round medallion has a stylized flower head forming a rosette.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: Small square table cover, pieced, of cream-color cotton block-printed in reds, violet, and green.  Corner design of large flowers and foliage; small all-over pattern of little buds.  Narrow floral border.  Green is blue over yellow.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: block-printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: Section of mantle; Made from 5 separately woven fabrics: No. 1) field or body of mantle with tie and dye pattern of diagonal "wave scrolls" in two shades of brown on ivory cotton. Nos. 2,3,4) and border - No. 2) toother 'herringbone' pattern in shades of brown and tan. No. 3) strips in tan, light brown, pink and olive-green. No. 4: yellow fringe. No. 5: narrow tape on edge with small hooked pattern in shades of tan and brown.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: complementary warps, resist-dye (tie dye); FABRIC NO. 1: openly woven plain weave, cotton; FABRIC NO. 2: tape (5 cm wide): warp faced plain weave patterned by extra warp floats, cotton; FABRIC NO. 3: tape (3 cm wide): warp faced plain weave patterned by warp stripes, cotton; FABRIC NO. 4: tape-fringe (3.5 cm wide): weft faced plain weave with cut loops of non-woven weft for fringe 2.5 cm long, wool; FABRIC NO. 5: tape (1 cm wide): warp faced plain weave patterned by extra weft floats, cotton

label: Description
value: Rectangular box with hinged lid, chamfered corners, fittings for missing handles at either end. Inlaid pattern of triangles on top, raised bandings around sides, top and bottom. Interior divided into three compartments; the two smaller compartments covered by hinged lids with raised “X” decoration.

label: Physical description
value: Copper-colored metal inlaid with white metal

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Maxime Hermanos; 1968: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Rectangular box with round corner posts, horseshoe-shaped hinges, hinged lid, top covered by paralleled bandings of scrolled wire patterns. Round bosses centers of each panel. Bottom: raised lines like cod tying package with a bow in the middle. Interior: tray divided into three compartments with four hinged lids decorated with raised “X” pattern.

label: Description
value: Rectangular box with hinged lid; horse-shoe-shaped handles decorated with wire scrolls at either end. Fabric band attached to handles. At top: pattern of inlaid brass-colored diamonds and bandings: raised banding around sides, top and bottom. Interior: tray with four compartments covered by hinged lids decorated with raised “X” pattern.

label: Physical description
value: Bronze-colored metal inlaid with brass-colored metal, woven band

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Maxime Hermanos; 1968: acquired by Museum
